world.description: Blackwood Manor stands silhouetted against a bruised, twilight sky, its once-grand facade now a ruin of decaying wood and shattered glass. Thorny vines, thick as a man's arm, strangle the stone walls, and the air around it hums with a palpable sense of dread. Inside, dust motes dance in the slivers of moonlight that pierce the gloom, illuminating cobweb-draped furniture and the spectral remnants of a tragic past. Each room whispers with the memories of its former inhabitants, their sorrow, rage, and despair clinging to the very fabric of the house like a shroud.

player.name: Elias Thorne
player.description: You are Elias Thorne, a renowned paranormal investigator who met an untimely end during a particularly volatile séance. Now, as a disembodied spirit yourself, you are drawn to places of intense psychic residue, seeking to understand the lingering echoes of the living and the dead. You possess the unique ability to perceive spiritual energy, interact with objects through telekinesis, and communicate with other entities, though your powers are limited by your own spiritual cohesion.
player.appearanceDescription: You are a spectral investigator, a wispy form of translucent ectoplasm, vaguely humanoid in shape. Your 'eyes' are two points of faint, pulsing blue light, and your ethereal 'body' shimmers with residual energy, leaving a faint trail of cold mist in your wake. You can phase through solid objects, but the stronger the material, the more effort it takes, leaving you momentarily drained.

Grand Foyer.name: Grand Foyer
Grand Foyer.description: You are in the grand foyer of Blackwood Manor. The air is cold and heavy with the scent of dust and decay. Shadows cling to the corners of the room, and the silence is broken only by the creaking of the old house.
Grand Foyer.appearanceDescription: You stand in what appears to be the grand foyer of Blackwood Manor. Moonlight streams through a gaping hole in the ceiling, illuminating a thick carpet of dust and fallen plaster. A massive, cobweb-shrouded chandelier hangs precariously overhead, its crystals long since shattered. To your left, a grand staircase, its banister splintered and broken, ascends into darkness. To your right, a heavy oak door, scarred and weathered, seems to lead to a more private wing of the manor. Directly ahead, a pair of imposing, rotting double doors, their hinges rusted through, stand slightly ajar, offering a glimpse into the manor's decaying heart.

Upper Hallway.name: Upper Hallway
Upper Hallway.description: This is the upper floor of Blackwood Manor. The corridor is long and oppressive, and the silence here feels heavy, as if waiting for a scream. The portraits seem to watch your every move, their painted eyes filled with an unnerving sadness.
Upper Hallway.appearanceDescription: The upper landing is a gallery of shadows, with portraits on the walls whose eyes seem to follow you. A long, dark corridor stretches out before you, lined with closed doors. The air here is colder, and the silence is broken only by the faint scuttling of unseen things.

The Study.name: The Study
The Study.description: The study exudes an aura of forgotten knowledge and quiet despair. The air is thick with the smell of decaying paper and old secrets. It feels as though the former occupant might return at any moment.
The Study.appearanceDescription: This room is a study, frozen in time. A large mahogany desk dominates the center, littered with quill pens, dried inkwells, and yellowed, brittle papers. Bookshelves line the walls, their leather-bound volumes crumbling and moth-eaten. A single, high-backed chair sits before the desk, draped in a tattered velvet cloth.

The Ballroom.name: The Ballroom
The Ballroom.description: This was once a place of merriment, but now it is a tomb of echoes. The silence here is profound, amplifying the sense of abandonment and the weight of the manor's tragic history. The air is heavy with a sorrow that seems to seep from the very walls.
The Ballroom.appearanceDescription: The ballroom is a grand but desolate space. A cracked marble floor stretches out, reflecting the faint moonlight. Tattered remnants of velvet curtains hang from tall, arched windows, and the ghostly outlines of long-vanished furniture can be seen on the floor. A decaying grand piano sits silently in one corner, its keys yellowed and broken.

Tarnished Locket.appearanceDescription: A tarnished silver locket lies half-buried in the dust near the base of the grand staircase. It is intricately carved with a floral pattern, but its surface is scratched and dulled with age.
Tarnished Locket.description: This locket feels cold to the touch and emanates a faint sense of melancholy. It may hold a memory or a clue to the manor's past.
Tarnished Locket.name: Tarnished Locket

Ornate Brass Key.appearanceDescription: A heavy, ornate brass key rests on a small, crumbling marble pedestal near the main entrance. It is intricately designed and appears quite old.
Ornate Brass Key.description: This key looks like it could unlock something important, perhaps a sturdy lock on one of the manor's many doors.
Ornate Brass Key.name: Ornate Brass Key

Tattered Velvet Pouch.description: This pouch looks like it might have been used to carry small, valuable items. It's currently empty.

Grand Foyer.description: A narrow, winding staircase of dark, rotting wood leads upwards from the foyer.
You push open the heavy, scarred oak door to your right, revealing a dimly lit study.
You cautiously push through the slightly ajar double doors ahead, entering a vast, cavernous ballroom.

Upper Hallway.description: You descend the creaking, unstable stairs back into the grand foyer.

The Study.description: You exit the dusty study, closing the oak door behind you and returning to the foyer.

The Ballroom.description: You retreat from the desolate ballroom, pushing the double doors shut behind you and returning to the foyer.

Echoes of past grandeur can still be felt, but they are overshadowed by an overwhelming sense of abandonment and sorrow. The silence is profound, broken only by the creaks and groans of the ancient house.
Foyer.appearanceDescription: The foyer is a cavernous space, dominated by a sweeping staircase that ascends into darkness. Dust sheets drape over what were once magnificent pieces of furniture, creating ghostly silhouettes. A massive, tarnished chandelier hangs precariously from the ceiling, its crystals long since lost. Moonlight filters weakly through a cracked stained-glass window, casting eerie patterns on the marble floor.

Study.name: Study
Study.description: The study once belonged to the master of Blackwood Manor, a place of quiet contemplation and rigorous study. Now, it holds the lingering aura of frustration and unfinished work. Papers are strewn about as if abandoned mid-sentence, and the silence here seems to press in, heavy with unvoiced thoughts.
Study.appearanceDescription: This study is a testament to a life of scholarly pursuit, now fallen into disarray. Bookshelves, many empty, line the walls, their contents scattered across the floor. A large mahogany desk sits in the center, its surface covered in a thick layer of dust, inkwells, and quill pens. A faded Persian rug lies beneath, its intricate patterns obscured by grime. The air is stale, carrying the faint scent of aged paper and something vaguely metallic.

Chamber of Whispers.name: Chamber of Whispers
Chamber of Whispers.description: This secret chamber appears to have been a place for arcane study or perhaps something more sinister. The objects here suggest a connection to forbidden knowledge and practices. The silence in this room is different; it feels watchful, as if the very objects are aware of your presence and are waiting.
Chamber of Whispers.appearanceDescription: This cramped, circular chamber is unnervingly cold. The walls are lined with shelves holding an array of peculiar objects: stoppered glass vials filled with dark liquids, dusty leather-bound tomes with unreadable script, and strange, intricately carved bone artifacts. In the center of the room, a pedestal supports a pulsating, amethyst-like crystal that emits a faint, eerie light. The air crackles with an almost imperceptible energy.

Tarnished Silver Locket.appearanceDescription: A tarnished silver locket, intricately engraved with swirling floral patterns, lies open. Inside, a faded miniature portrait of a stern-faced woman is visible.

container.howToOpen: The pouch is opened by gently pulling apart its frayed drawstring.
container.howToStoreItem: Items are placed inside the pouch by carefully tucking them into its velvety depths and then securing the drawstring.

Tarnished Silver Locket.description: This locket seems to hold a fragment of memory, a captured moment from a life long past. The silver, though dulled by time, hints at a former opulence. It feels cool to the touch, carrying a faint scent of dried lavender.
Tarnished Silver Locket.name: Tarnished Silver Locket

Raven's Feather.appearanceDescription: A single, perfectly preserved raven feather rests within the pouch. Its shaft is smooth and obsidian black, while the barbs shimmer with an iridescent blue-green sheen under the moonlight.

container.howToOpen: The pouch is opened by gently pulling apart its frayed drawstring.
container.howToStoreItem: Items are placed inside the pouch by carefully tucking them into its velvety depths and then securing the drawstring.

Raven's Feather.description: This feather feels unnaturally light, yet strangely substantial. It carries an aura of the wild and untamed, a whisper from the dark woods surrounding Blackwood Manor. Holding it seems to evoke a sense of quiet watchfulness.
Raven's Feather.name: Raven's Feather

Carved Wooden Bird.appearanceDescription: A small, intricately carved wooden bird, no larger than a thumb, sits nestled in the pouch. Its tiny wings are spread as if in mid-flight, and its eyes are two minuscule chips of polished jet.

container.howToOpen: The pouch is opened by gently pulling apart its frayed drawstring.
container.howToStoreItem: Items are placed inside the pouch by carefully tucking them into its velvety depths and then securing the drawstring.

Carved Wooden Bird.description: This miniature carving is a marvel of craftsmanship, depicting a bird with astonishing detail. The wood itself seems to emanate a faint warmth, and there's a subtle, almost imperceptible hum when held close to the ear, as if it retains a spark of life.
Carved Wooden Bird.name: Carved Wooden Bird

Weeping Willow Locket.appearanceDescription: A tarnished silver locket, intricately engraved with a weeping willow tree, lies on the dusty floor. It feels unnaturally cold to the touch.

container.howToOpen: Gently pry it open.
container.howToStoreItem: Place small items within its delicate confines.

Weeping Willow Locket.description: This locket seems to hold a deep sadness. Perhaps it belonged to one of the manor's tragic inhabitants.
Weeping Willow Locket.name: Weeping Willow Locket

Withered Black Rose.appearanceDescription: A single, withered black rose rests on a small, ornate side table. Its petals are brittle and dark, crumbling at the slightest disturbance.
Withered Black Rose.description: The rose seems to be a symbol of lost love or a permanent farewell. Its presence here is unsettling.
Withered Black Rose.name: Withered Black Rose

Resonant Golden Key.appearanceDescription: A heavy, ornate golden key rests on a velvet cushion placed precisely in the center of the hallway. The key is strangely warm and hums with a low, resonant frequency.
Resonant Golden Key.description: This key feels important, imbued with a power that hints at unlocking more than just a physical door. Its golden sheen gleams unnaturally in the dim light.
Resonant Golden Key.name: Resonant Golden Key

Frozen Grandfather Clock.appearanceDescription: A grandfather clock stands silent and imposing against one wall. Its face is cracked, and its pendulum is still, yet a faint, rhythmic ticking can be heard emanating from within, seemingly out of sync with time itself.

container.howToOpen: Carefully open the glass door in the front.
container.howToStoreItem: Place small items behind the still pendulum.

Frozen Grandfather Clock.description: This clock seems to be frozen in a moment of despair, its ticking a ghostly echo of the past. It holds a sense of frozen time.
Frozen Grandfather Clock.name: Frozen Grandfather Clock

pickupable.reasonWhyNotPickup: The clock is too heavy and is firmly fixed to the wall.

Locket of Lingering Sorrows.appearanceDescription: A single, tarnished silver locket, intricately engraved with a weeping willow tree. It feels unnaturally cold to the touch, and a faint, sorrowful melody seems to emanate from its depths.

container.howToOpen: The glass door of the grandfather clock can be opened by gently pulling on the ornate brass handle.
container.howToStoreItem: Items can be placed inside the grandfather clock by opening its glass door and carefully setting them within the main cavity.

Locket of Lingering Sorrows.description: This locket seems to hold the very essence of sadness. It is rumored to contain the last tear shed by Lady Eleanor before her tragic demise within these walls. Holding it might reveal forgotten memories, or perhaps amplify one's own deepest regrets.
Locket of Lingering Sorrows.name: Locket of Lingering Sorrows

Clockwork Nightingale.appearanceDescription: A small, exquisitely carved wooden bird, its wings outstretched as if in mid-flight. It is made from a dark, unfamiliar wood and feels surprisingly weighty for its size. Tiny, almost imperceptible gears are visible beneath its carved feathers.

container.howToOpen: The glass door of the grandfather clock can be opened by gently pulling on the ornate brass handle.
container.howToStoreItem: Items can be placed inside the grandfather clock by opening its glass door and carefully setting them within the main cavity.

Clockwork Nightingale.description: This automaton bird appears to be a marvel of craftsmanship from a bygone era. When wound, it is said to sing a lullaby so beautiful it can bring peace to even the most tormented soul, though its mechanism appears long dormant, frozen alongside the clock.
Clockwork Nightingale.name: Clockwork Nightingale

Chronometer's Finger.appearanceDescription: A single, skeletal finger bone, polished smooth as glass. It is unnaturally long and thin, and a faint, chilling mist seems to perpetually cling to its surface.

container.howToOpen: The glass door of the grandfather clock can be opened by gently pulling on the ornate brass handle.
container.howToStoreItem: Items can be placed inside the grandfather clock by opening its glass door and carefully setting them within the main cavity.

Chronometer's Finger.description: This bone radiates an aura of temporal displacement. Legends whisper that it belonged to a chronomancer who attempted to unravel the mysteries of time itself within Blackwood Manor, only to be consumed by his own ambition. Touching it might cause brief, disorienting glimpses of the past or future.
Chronometer's Finger.name: Chronometer's Finger

Vial of a Frozen Tear.appearanceDescription: A single, dried tear, preserved within a miniature glass vial. It shimmers faintly with an inner light, and a wisp of ethereal mist curls around its stopper.

container.howToOpen: The locket opens with a gentle click when pressed on its side.
container.howToStoreItem: Items can be placed inside the locket by carefully opening it and placing them within its velvet-lined interior.

Vial of a Frozen Tear.description: This vial contains what appears to be a solidified tear, radiating a faint aura of sorrow. Legend says that tears shed in true despair can sometimes retain a fragment of the emotion that created them.
Vial of a Frozen Tear.name: Vial of a Frozen Tear

Ribbon of Whispers.appearanceDescription: A faded, silk ribbon, once a vibrant emerald green, now bleached to a pale, ghostly hue. A single, perfectly preserved dewdrop, impossibly still, clings to its frayed end.

container.howToOpen: The locket opens with a gentle click when pressed on its side.
container.howToStoreItem: Items can be placed inside the locket by carefully opening it and placing them within its velvet-lined interior.

Ribbon of Whispers.description: This ribbon carries the faint scent of honeysuckle and the lingering whisper of forgotten laughter. It is said to have been a token of affection, lost during a time of great upheaval within the manor.
Ribbon of Whispers.name: Ribbon of Whispers

Key to Forgotten Sorrows.appearanceDescription: A miniature, tarnished silver key, no larger than a thumbnail. Its teeth are intricately carved into the shape of tiny, weeping willow leaves.

container.howToOpen: The locket opens with a gentle click when pressed on its side.
container.howToStoreItem: Items can be placed inside the locket by carefully opening it and placing them within its velvet-lined interior.

Key to Forgotten Sorrows.description: This tiny key feels impossibly heavy for its size, as if burdened by the secrets it guards. It is rumored to unlock not a physical door, but a hidden passage within the heart, or perhaps a forgotten memory.
Key to Forgotten Sorrows.name: Key to Forgotten Sorrows

You cautiously push through the slightly ajar double doors ahead, entering a vast, cavernous ballroom.

A grand, yet decaying, staircase leads down to the foyer.

The Ballroom.description: You retreat from the desolate ballroom, pushing the double doors shut behind you and returning to the foyer.

Study.description: The study door opens back into the upper hallway.

Chamber of Whispers.description: Pushing aside the heavy tapestry reveals the doorway back to the upper hallway.

A massive, cobweb-shrouded chandelier hangs precariously overhead, its crystals long since shattered. To your left, a grand staircase, its banister splintered and broken, ascends into darkness. To your right, a heavy oak door, scarred and weathered, seems to lead to a more private wing of the manor. Directly ahead, a pair of imposing, rotting double doors, their hinges rusted through, stand slightly ajar, offering a glimpse into the manor's decaying heart.

Upper Hallway.name: Upper Hallway
Upper Hallway.description: This is the upper floor of Blackwood Manor. The corridor is long and oppressive, and the silence here feels heavy, as if waiting for a scream. The portraits seem to watch your every move, their painted eyes filled with an unnerving sadness.
Upper Hallway.appearanceDescription: The upper landing is a gallery of shadows, with portraits on the walls whose eyes seem to follow you. A long, dark corridor stretches out before you, lined with closed doors. The air here is colder, and the silence is broken only by the faint scuttling of unseen things.

The Study.name: The Study
The Study.description: The study exudes an aura of forgotten knowledge and quiet despair. The air is thick with the smell of decaying paper and old secrets. It feels as though the former occupant might return at any moment.
The Study.appearanceDescription: This room is a study, frozen in time. A large mahogany desk dominates the center, littered with quill pens, dried inkwells, and yellowed, brittle papers. The Ballroom.name: The Ballroom
The Ballroom.description: This was once a place of merriment, but now it is a tomb of echoes. The silence here is profound, amplifying the sense of abandonment and the weight of the manor's tragic history. The air is heavy with a sorrow that seems to seep from the very walls.
The Ballroom.appearanceDescription: The ballroom is a grand but desolate space. A cracked marble floor stretches out, reflecting the faint moonlight. Tattered remnants of velvet curtains hang from tall, arched windows, and the ghostly outlines of long-vanished furniture can be seen on the floor. A decaying grand piano sits silently in one corner, its keys yellowed and broken.

Each room whispers with the memories of its former inhabitants, their sorrow, rage, and despair clinging to the very fabric of the house like a shroud.

turns.description: Elias Thorne, now a specter bound to the spectral plane, glides through the oppressive silence of the Upper Hallway. The painted eyes of the portraits lining the corridor seem to track his ethereal form, their mournful gazes fixed upon him. He perceives the ambient spiritual energy, a tapestry woven with threads of sorrow and regret, and his attention is drawn to several objects that hum with residual psychic force: a *Weeping Willow Locket*, radiating an aura of profound sadness; a *Withered Black Rose*, a somber symbol of eternal farewell; a *Resonant Golden Key*, its gleam unnatural and pulsing with latent energy; and a *Frozen Grandfather Clock*, its stillness a chilling testament to a moment lost in time.

world.description: Blackwood Manor stands silhouetted against a bruised, twilight sky, its once-grand facade now a ruin of decaying wood and shattered glass. Thorny vines, thick as a man's arm, strangle the stone walls, and the air around it hums with a palpable sense of dread. Inside, dust motes dance in the slivers of moonlight that pierce the gloom, illuminating cobweb-draped furniture and the spectral remnants of a tragic past. Each room whispers with the memories of its former inhabitants, their sorrow, rage, and despair clinging to the very fabric of the house like a shroud.

player.name: Elias Thorne
player.description: You are Elias Thorne, a renowned paranormal investigator who met an untimely end during a particularly volatile séance. Now, as a disembodied spirit yourself, you are drawn to places of intense psychic residue, seeking to understand the lingering echoes of the living and the dead. You possess the unique ability to perceive spiritual energy, interact with objects through telekinesis, and communicate with other entities, though your powers are limited by your own spiritual cohesion.
player.appearanceDescription: You are a spectral investigator, a wispy form of translucent ectoplasm, vaguely humanoid in shape. Your 'eyes' are two points of faint, pulsing blue light, and your ethereal 'body' shimmers with residual energy, leaving a faint trail of cold mist in your wake. You can phase through solid objects, but the stronger the material, the more effort it takes, leaving you momentarily drained.

Grand Foyer.name: Grand Foyer
Grand Foyer.description: You are in the grand foyer of Blackwood Manor. The air is cold and heavy with the scent of dust and decay. Shadows cling to the corners of the room, and the silence is broken only by the creaking of the old house.
Grand Foyer.appearanceDescription: You stand in what appears to be the grand foyer of Blackwood Manor. Moonlight streams through a gaping hole in the ceiling, illuminating a thick carpet of dust and fallen plaster. A massive, cobweb-shrouded chandelier hangs precariously overhead, its crystals long since shattered. To your left, a grand staircase, its banister splintered and broken, ascends into darkness. To your right, a heavy oak door, scarred and weathered, seems to lead to a more private wing of the manor. Directly ahead, a pair of imposing, rotting double doors, their hinges rusted through, stand slightly ajar, offering a glimpse into the manor's decaying heart.

Upper Hallway.name: Upper Hallway
Upper Hallway.description: This is the upper floor of Blackwood Manor. The corridor is long and oppressive, and the silence here feels heavy, as if waiting for a scream. The portraits seem to watch your every move, their painted eyes filled with an unnerving sadness.
Upper Hallway.appearanceDescription: The upper landing is a gallery of shadows, with portraits on the walls whose eyes seem to follow you. A long, dark corridor stretches out before you, lined with closed doors. The air here is colder, and the silence is broken only by the faint scuttling of unseen things.

The Study.name: The Study
The Study.description: The study exudes an aura of forgotten knowledge and quiet despair. The air is thick with the smell of decaying paper and old secrets. It feels as though the former occupant might return at any moment.
The Study.appearanceDescription: This room is a study, frozen in time. A large mahogany desk dominates the center, littered with quill pens, dried inkwells, and yellowed, brittle papers. Bookshelves line the walls, their leather-bound volumes crumbling and moth-eaten. A single, high-backed chair sits before the desk, draped in a tattered velvet cloth.

The Ballroom.name: The Ballroom
The Ballroom.description: This was once a place of merriment, but now it is a tomb of echoes. The silence here is profound, amplifying the sense of abandonment and the weight of the manor's tragic history. The air is heavy with a sorrow that seems to seep from the very walls.
The Ballroom.appearanceDescription: The ballroom is a grand but desolate space. A cracked marble floor stretches out, reflecting the faint moonlight. Tattered remnants of velvet curtains hang from tall, arched windows, and the ghostly outlines of long-vanished furniture can be seen on the floor. A decaying grand piano sits silently in one corner, its keys yellowed and broken.

Foyer.name: Foyer
Foyer.description: The foyer serves as the main entrance to Blackwood Manor. The air here is thick with the scent of old dust and decay. Echoes of past grandeur can still be felt, but they are overshadowed by an overwhelming sense of abandonment and sorrow. The silence is profound, broken only by the creaks and groans of the ancient house.
Foyer.appearanceDescription: The foyer is a cavernous space, dominated by a sweeping staircase that ascends into darkness. Dust sheets drape over what were once magnificent pieces of furniture, creating ghostly silhouettes. A massive, tarnished chandelier hangs precariously from the ceiling, its crystals long since lost. Moonlight filters weakly through a cracked stained-glass window, casting eerie patterns on the marble floor.

Study.name: Study
Study.description: The study once belonged to the master of Blackwood Manor, a place of quiet contemplation and rigorous study. Now, it holds the lingering aura of frustration and unfinished work. Papers are strewn about as if abandoned mid-sentence, and the silence here seems to press in, heavy with unvoiced thoughts.
Study.appearanceDescription: This study is a testament to a life of scholarly pursuit, now fallen into disarray. Bookshelves, many empty, line the walls, their contents scattered across the floor. A large mahogany desk sits in the center, its surface covered in a thick layer of dust, inkwells, and quill pens. A faded Persian rug lies beneath, its intricate patterns obscured by grime. The air is stale, carrying the faint scent of aged paper and something vaguely metallic.

Chamber of Whispers.name: Chamber of Whispers
Chamber of Whispers.description: This secret chamber appears to have been a place for arcane study or perhaps something more sinister. The objects here suggest a connection to forbidden knowledge and practices. The silence in this room is different; it feels watchful, as if the very objects are aware of your presence and are waiting.
Chamber of Whispers.appearanceDescription: This cramped, circular chamber is unnervingly cold. The walls are lined with shelves holding an array of peculiar objects: stoppered glass vials filled with dark liquids, dusty leather-bound tomes with unreadable script, and strange, intricately carved bone artifacts. In the center of the room, a pedestal supports a pulsating, amethyst-like crystal that emits a faint, eerie light. The air crackles with an almost imperceptible energy.

Tarnished Locket.appearanceDescription: A tarnished silver locket lies half-buried in the dust near the base of the grand staircase. It is intricately carved with a floral pattern, but its surface is scratched and dulled with age.
Tarnished Locket.description: This locket feels cold to the touch and emanates a faint sense of melancholy. It may hold a memory or a clue to the manor's past.
Tarnished Locket.name: Tarnished Locket

Ornate Brass Key.description: This key looks like it could unlock something important, perhaps a sturdy lock on one of the manor's many doors.
Ornate Brass Key.name: Ornate Brass Key

Weeping Willow Locket.description: This locket seems to hold a deep sadness. Perhaps it belonged to one of the manor's tragic inhabitants.

Withered Black Rose.name: Withered Black Rose

Resonant Golden Key.appearanceDescription: A heavy, ornate golden key rests on a velvet cushion placed precisely in the center of the hallway. The key is strangely warm and hums with a low, resonant frequency.
Resonant Golden Key.description: This key feels important, imbued with a power that hints at unlocking more than just a physical door. Its golden sheen gleams unnaturally in the dim light.

Frozen Grandfather Clock.appearanceDescription: A grandfather clock stands silent and imposing against one wall. Its face is cracked, and its pendulum is still, yet a faint, rhythmic ticking can be heard emanating from within, seemingly out of sync with time itself.

container.howToOpen: Carefully open the glass door in the front.
container.howToStoreItem: Place small items behind the still pendulum.

Frozen Grandfather Clock.description: This clock seems to be frozen in a moment of despair, its ticking a ghostly echo of the past. It holds a sense of frozen time.
Frozen Grandfather Clock.name: Frozen Grandfather Clock

turns.description: Elias Thorne, a spectral investigator, drifts towards the Weeping Willow Locket, its palpable sadness a beacon in the oppressive silence of the upper hallway.
